metadata.title: CVE-2019-15890 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
libslirp 4.0.0, as used in QEMU 4.1.0, has a use-after-free in ip_reass inip_input.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15890` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47').
xen: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
